intro: Peucedanum huangshanense, commonly known as Huangshan cowparsley, is a rare and endemic species native to the Huangshan Mountains in China. It is a biennial or perennial herb characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
